span.b: The Perryton ISD school counselors want to reach out to the parents of PISD children, offering our support to you and your children. If your child (children) needs additional emotional or academic support, please reach out to us through our email addresses listed below. We know this current situation can create additional anxiety and fear in people of all ages, and our job is to help each child in our district at all times, but especially in these times. It is difficult for us to spend each day without the privilege of seeing our students. Most often, a visual check tells us how things are going for our students. Without that opportunity, we are reaching out through surveys sent to our students to check on their emotional and social well-being and responding when necessary. We are also pushing out notes of encouragement and offers of support to all of our students through each counselor’s Google Classrooms and Remind groups, through which students may also reach out to their counselors. We have joined in remotely on regional and local meetings planning and preparing to care for and support the children and employees of our district and are being responsive to our community’s needs. Our goals during this pandemic are that our students will maintain a healthy balance of mental, social / emotional, and physical well being; will be confident in their ability to succeed; will have adequate coping skills during these times; and will demonstrate social maturity and behaviors that are appropriate to this situation and our changing environment. If we can be of any assistance to your children or you, please email us.

div.p: Our resolve is to integrate students, teachers, parents and community in a highly motivated, positive learning process. It is our intent to involve all cultures, to increase opportunities for parental involvement through constant communication of student progress, reward strong character and positive attitude, and celebrate academic achievement. Consequently, students will be motivated to make informed, responsible choices and become life-long learners and productive members of society.
